snippet: A federal judge on Madison, Wis., threw out Apple’s suit that licensing practices by Google’s Motorola unit were unfair, saying she was unsure she had the authority to hear the claim.
abstract: Federal Judge Barbara B Crabb in Madison, Wis, throws out Apple's lawsuit against Google's Motorola unit that claimed patent abuse, saying she is unsure she has authority to hear claim; action is setback for iPhone maker in its efforts to gain leverage in smartphone patent wars.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Madison, Wis., threw out Apple’s suit that licensing practices by Google’s Motorola unit were unfair, saying she was unsure she had the authority to hear the claim.
